action.action-desc: Mr. Russell introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Agriculture

form.official-title: To amend the Federal Crop Insurance Act to eliminate premium subsidies for crop insurance for tobacco.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the End Subsidies for Tobacco Act.

section.header: Prohibition on payment of portion of premium by corporation for tobacco
section.text: Section 508(e) of the Federal Crop Insurance Act (7 U.S.C. 1508(e)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.header: Prohibition on payment of portion of premium by corporation for tobacco

subparagraph.text: Effective beginning with the 2018 reinsurance year, notwithstanding any other provision of this subtitle, the Corporation shall not pay any portion of the premium for a policy or plan of insurance for tobacco under this subtitle.
Any savings realized as a result of subparagraph (A) shall be deposited in the Treasury and used for Federal budget deficit reduction.
